        - We're in the interpreter (--regexp-interpret-all may help to repro).<span class="line"><!---->- We're in the interpreter (--regexp-interpret-all may help to repro).<!----></span><br>- Runtime_RegExpExecTreatMatchAtEndAsFailure in the backtrace tells us we're in RegExp.p.split; in the repro there are only 4 such calls:<span class="line"><!---->- Runtime_RegExpExecTreatMatchAtEndAsFailure in the backtrace tells us we're in RegExp.p.split; in the repro there are only 4 such calls:<!----></span><br><br>var substitution_re = /\$\{([^ }]*)\}/g;<span class="line"><!---->var substitution_re = /\$\{([^ }]*)\}/g;<!----></span><br>var components = input.split(substitution_re);<span class="line"><!---->var components = input.split(substitution_re);<!----></span><br><br>var lines = stack.split("\n");<span class="line"><!---->var lines = stack.split("\n");<!----></span><br><br>var components = name.split(".");<span class="line"><!---->var components = name.split(".");<!----></span><br><br>output_location = assert.stack.split("\n", 1)<span class="line"><!---->output_location = assert.stack.split("\n", 1)<!----></span><br><br>- The flaky repro & OOB read could be a symptom of the GC moving the bytecode array without irregexp updating its pointers.<span class="line"><!---->- The flaky repro &amp; OOB read could be a symptom of the GC moving the bytecode array without irregexp updating its pointers.<!----></span><br>- Or something goes wrong during bytecode interpretation causing us to read OOB.<span class="line"><!---->- Or something goes wrong during bytecode interpretation causing us to read OOB.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I'm still having difficulty reproducing this in a stable, debuggable way. To summarize findings so far:<span class="line"><!---->I'm still having difficulty reproducing this in a stable, debuggable way. To summarize findings so far:<!----></span><br><br>- There appear to be two different crashes, see the backtraces in <span class="line"><!---->- There appear to be two different crashes, see the backtraces in <!----></span>#c15<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c15"><!---->#c15<!----></a> (crash in irregexp) and in <span class="line"><!----> (crash in irregexp) and in <!----></span>#c14<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c14"><!---->#c14<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>#c16<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c16"><!---->#c16<!----></a> (something else). I've only investigated the former in this bug report.<span class="line"><!----> (something else). I've only investigated the former in this bug report.<!----></span><br>- Crashes are reproduced by clicking HavTest and refreshing. Sometimes the crash seems to reproduce easily, at other times it can take many attempts. Due to memory pressure? Due to cache states? It seems to help to change window focus before refreshing the page.<span class="line"><!---->- Crashes are reproduced by clicking HavTest and refreshing. Sometimes the crash seems to reproduce easily, at other times it can take many attempts. Due to memory pressure? Due to cache states? It seems to help to change window focus before refreshing the page.<!----></span><br>- I attempted to bisect but the crash is too flaky.<span class="line"><!---->- I attempted to bisect but the crash is too flaky.<!----></span><br>- The symptoms quite clearly point at a problem with the regexp bytecode array or regexp interpreter dispatch, specifically dispatch seems to jump to an invalid address (we use the computed goto extension for interpreter dispatch).<span class="line"><!---->- The symptoms quite clearly point at a problem with the regexp bytecode array or regexp interpreter dispatch, specifically dispatch seems to jump to an invalid address (we use the computed goto extension for interpreter dispatch).<!----></span><br>- This can happen either because the read bytecode is invalid (the bytecode array may be corrupted, may have moved, we may read OOB, or may not be a bytecode array at all); or because ASAN somehow interferes with the computed goto extension. The latter is not an academic possibility, we've seen crashes related due to addtl requirements on registers from ASAN in the past.<span class="line"><!---->- This can happen either because the read bytecode is invalid (the bytecode array may be corrupted, may have moved, we may read OOB, or may not be a bytecode array at all); or because ASAN somehow interferes with the computed goto extension. The latter is not an academic possibility, we've seen crashes related due to addtl requirements on registers from ASAN in the past.<!----></span><br>- Unfortunately I haven't managed to debug this properly yet. On my linux laptop, I get neither an ASAN report, nor does gdb break on the segv. On my Windows VM, after jumping through many hoops, I do get symbolized ASAN reports - but the crash is super-flaky and I know nothing about debugging chromium with windbg. Plus the VM is severely resource-constrained and I can't compile custom builds there.<span class="line"><!---->- Unfortunately I haven't managed to debug this properly yet. On my linux laptop, I get neither an ASAN report, nor does gdb break on the segv. On my Windows VM, after jumping through many hoops, I do get symbolized ASAN reports - but the crash is super-flaky and I know nothing about debugging chromium with windbg. Plus the VM is severely resource-constrained and I can't compile custom builds there.<!----></span><br>- Next steps: attempt to repro on a non-ASAN build.<span class="line"><!---->- Next steps: attempt to repro on a non-ASAN build.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tracing isolate creation and flag values suggests something is altering flag values after the Isolate has started:<span class="line"><!---->Tracing isolate creation and flag values suggests something is altering flag values after the Isolate has started:<!----></span><br><br>Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e2b10 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e2b10 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e24d0 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e24d0 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x7fe744008d50 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x7fe744008d50 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x7fe70800d570 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x7fe70800d570 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<!----></span><br>[...]<span class="line"><!---->[...]<!----></span><br>isolate 0x55614d0e2b10  // Immediately prior to the DCHECK failure.<span class="line"><!---->isolate 0x55614d0e2b10  // Immediately prior to the DCHECK failure.<!----></span><br><br>Note isolate 0x55614d0e2b10 starts with --regexp-interpret-all unset but has the flag set prior to the crash.<span class="line"><!---->Note isolate 0x55614d0e2b10 starts with --regexp-interpret-all unset but has the flag set prior to the crash.<!----></span><br><br>It looks like chrome is misusing V8 by starting multiple isolates with different jitless configs in the same process. I vaguely recall hearing related chatter in recent months, gotta do some research.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like chrome is misusing V8 by starting multiple isolates with different jitless configs in the same process. I vaguely recall hearing related chatter in recent months, gotta do some research.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #38: Thanks, that confirms my suspicions. Since v8 flags are process-wide, it's not valid to spawn multiple isolates with different flags in the same process. For --jitless and friends (e.g. --regexp-interpret-all) it's especially problematic. I suspect the second bug report with different symptoms (<span class="line"><!---->#38: Thanks, that confirms my suspicions. Since v8 flags are process-wide, it's not valid to spawn multiple isolates with different flags in the same process. For --jitless and friends (e.g. --regexp-interpret-all) it's especially problematic. I suspect the second bug report with different symptoms (<!----></span>crbug.com/1264813<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264813" title="AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x7ed000084040"><!---->crbug.com/1264813<!----></a>) may have the same root cause.<span class="line"><!---->) may have the same root cause.<!----></span><br><br>1) Since SharedStorageAPI is *not* on by default, there is currently no direct user-visible impact.<span class="line"><!---->1) Since SharedStorageAPI is *not* on by default, there is currently no direct user-visible impact.<!----></span><br><br>2) SharedStorageAPI is currently spawns V8 isolates in a way that interferes with other V8 isolates in the same renderer process and will lead to all kinds of hard-to-debug followup errors. The solution is to not spawn SharedStorageAPI isolates with custom flags (-> remove --jitless).<span class="line"><!---->2) SharedStorageAPI is currently spawns V8 isolates in a way that interferes with other V8 isolates in the same renderer process and will lead to all kinds of hard-to-debug followup errors. The solution is to not spawn SharedStorageAPI isolates with custom flags (-&gt; remove --jitless).<!----></span><br><br>3) For the V8 side, two potential work items are in <span class="line"><!---->3) For the V8 side, two potential work items are in <!----></span>#c34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->#c34<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>yaoxia@ I'm reassigning to you for point 2) above.<span class="line"><!---->yaoxia@ I'm reassigning to you for point 2) above.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Merge review required: M97 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M97 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<span class="line"><!---->4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br>6.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {

        }

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

    display: inline;

    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    text-decoration: underline;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {

  }

    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        - We're in the interpreter (--regexp-interpret-all may help to repro).<span class="line"><!---->- We're in the interpreter (--regexp-interpret-all may help to repro).<!----></span><br>- Runtime_RegExpExecTreatMatchAtEndAsFailure in the backtrace tells us we're in RegExp.p.split; in the repro there are only 4 such calls:<span class="line"><!---->- Runtime_RegExpExecTreatMatchAtEndAsFailure in the backtrace tells us we're in RegExp.p.split; in the repro there are only 4 such calls:<!----></span><br><br>var substitution_re = /\$\{([^ }]*)\}/g;<span class="line"><!---->var substitution_re = /\$\{([^ }]*)\}/g;<!----></span><br>var components = input.split(substitution_re);<span class="line"><!---->var components = input.split(substitution_re);<!----></span><br><br>var lines = stack.split("\n");<span class="line"><!---->var lines = stack.split("\n");<!----></span><br><br>var components = name.split(".");<span class="line"><!---->var components = name.split(".");<!----></span><br><br>output_location = assert.stack.split("\n", 1)<span class="line"><!---->output_location = assert.stack.split("\n", 1)<!----></span><br><br>- The flaky repro & OOB read could be a symptom of the GC moving the bytecode array without irregexp updating its pointers.<span class="line"><!---->- The flaky repro &amp; OOB read could be a symptom of the GC moving the bytecode array without irregexp updating its pointers.<!----></span><br>- Or something goes wrong during bytecode interpretation causing us to read OOB.<span class="line"><!---->- Or something goes wrong during bytecode interpretation causing us to read OOB.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I'm still having difficulty reproducing this in a stable, debuggable way. To summarize findings so far:<span class="line"><!---->I'm still having difficulty reproducing this in a stable, debuggable way. To summarize findings so far:<!----></span><br><br>- There appear to be two different crashes, see the backtraces in <span class="line"><!---->- There appear to be two different crashes, see the backtraces in <!----></span>#c15<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c15"><!---->#c15<!----></a> (crash in irregexp) and in <span class="line"><!----> (crash in irregexp) and in <!----></span>#c14<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c14"><!---->#c14<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>#c16<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c16"><!---->#c16<!----></a> (something else). I've only investigated the former in this bug report.<span class="line"><!----> (something else). I've only investigated the former in this bug report.<!----></span><br>- Crashes are reproduced by clicking HavTest and refreshing. Sometimes the crash seems to reproduce easily, at other times it can take many attempts. Due to memory pressure? Due to cache states? It seems to help to change window focus before refreshing the page.<span class="line"><!---->- Crashes are reproduced by clicking HavTest and refreshing. Sometimes the crash seems to reproduce easily, at other times it can take many attempts. Due to memory pressure? Due to cache states? It seems to help to change window focus before refreshing the page.<!----></span><br>- I attempted to bisect but the crash is too flaky.<span class="line"><!---->- I attempted to bisect but the crash is too flaky.<!----></span><br>- The symptoms quite clearly point at a problem with the regexp bytecode array or regexp interpreter dispatch, specifically dispatch seems to jump to an invalid address (we use the computed goto extension for interpreter dispatch).<span class="line"><!---->- The symptoms quite clearly point at a problem with the regexp bytecode array or regexp interpreter dispatch, specifically dispatch seems to jump to an invalid address (we use the computed goto extension for interpreter dispatch).<!----></span><br>- This can happen either because the read bytecode is invalid (the bytecode array may be corrupted, may have moved, we may read OOB, or may not be a bytecode array at all); or because ASAN somehow interferes with the computed goto extension. The latter is not an academic possibility, we've seen crashes related due to addtl requirements on registers from ASAN in the past.<span class="line"><!---->- This can happen either because the read bytecode is invalid (the bytecode array may be corrupted, may have moved, we may read OOB, or may not be a bytecode array at all); or because ASAN somehow interferes with the computed goto extension. The latter is not an academic possibility, we've seen crashes related due to addtl requirements on registers from ASAN in the past.<!----></span><br>- Unfortunately I haven't managed to debug this properly yet. On my linux laptop, I get neither an ASAN report, nor does gdb break on the segv. On my Windows VM, after jumping through many hoops, I do get symbolized ASAN reports - but the crash is super-flaky and I know nothing about debugging chromium with windbg. Plus the VM is severely resource-constrained and I can't compile custom builds there.<span class="line"><!---->- Unfortunately I haven't managed to debug this properly yet. On my linux laptop, I get neither an ASAN report, nor does gdb break on the segv. On my Windows VM, after jumping through many hoops, I do get symbolized ASAN reports - but the crash is super-flaky and I know nothing about debugging chromium with windbg. Plus the VM is severely resource-constrained and I can't compile custom builds there.<!----></span><br>- Next steps: attempt to repro on a non-ASAN build.<span class="line"><!---->- Next steps: attempt to repro on a non-ASAN build.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tracing isolate creation and flag values suggests something is altering flag values after the Isolate has started:<span class="line"><!---->Tracing isolate creation and flag values suggests something is altering flag values after the Isolate has started:<!----></span><br><br>Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e2b10 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e2b10 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e24d0 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e24d0 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x7fe744008d50 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x7fe744008d50 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x7fe70800d570 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x7fe70800d570 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<!----></span><br>[...]<span class="line"><!---->[...]<!----></span><br>isolate 0x55614d0e2b10  // Immediately prior to the DCHECK failure.<span class="line"><!---->isolate 0x55614d0e2b10  // Immediately prior to the DCHECK failure.<!----></span><br><br>Note isolate 0x55614d0e2b10 starts with --regexp-interpret-all unset but has the flag set prior to the crash.<span class="line"><!---->Note isolate 0x55614d0e2b10 starts with --regexp-interpret-all unset but has the flag set prior to the crash.<!----></span><br><br>It looks like chrome is misusing V8 by starting multiple isolates with different jitless configs in the same process. I vaguely recall hearing related chatter in recent months, gotta do some research.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like chrome is misusing V8 by starting multiple isolates with different jitless configs in the same process. I vaguely recall hearing related chatter in recent months, gotta do some research.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #38: Thanks, that confirms my suspicions. Since v8 flags are process-wide, it's not valid to spawn multiple isolates with different flags in the same process. For --jitless and friends (e.g. --regexp-interpret-all) it's especially problematic. I suspect the second bug report with different symptoms (<span class="line"><!---->#38: Thanks, that confirms my suspicions. Since v8 flags are process-wide, it's not valid to spawn multiple isolates with different flags in the same process. For --jitless and friends (e.g. --regexp-interpret-all) it's especially problematic. I suspect the second bug report with different symptoms (<!----></span>crbug.com/1264813<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264813" title="AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x7ed000084040"><!---->crbug.com/1264813<!----></a>) may have the same root cause.<span class="line"><!---->) may have the same root cause.<!----></span><br><br>1) Since SharedStorageAPI is *not* on by default, there is currently no direct user-visible impact.<span class="line"><!---->1) Since SharedStorageAPI is *not* on by default, there is currently no direct user-visible impact.<!----></span><br><br>2) SharedStorageAPI is currently spawns V8 isolates in a way that interferes with other V8 isolates in the same renderer process and will lead to all kinds of hard-to-debug followup errors. The solution is to not spawn SharedStorageAPI isolates with custom flags (-> remove --jitless).<span class="line"><!---->2) SharedStorageAPI is currently spawns V8 isolates in a way that interferes with other V8 isolates in the same renderer process and will lead to all kinds of hard-to-debug followup errors. The solution is to not spawn SharedStorageAPI isolates with custom flags (-&gt; remove --jitless).<!----></span><br><br>3) For the V8 side, two potential work items are in <span class="line"><!---->3) For the V8 side, two potential work items are in <!----></span>#c34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->#c34<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>yaoxia@ I'm reassigning to you for point 2) above.<span class="line"><!---->yaoxia@ I'm reassigning to you for point 2) above.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Merge review required: M97 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M97 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<span class="line"><!---->4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br>6.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

            width: 100%;

            border: 0;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        jgruber, can you please help triage?<span class="line"><!---->jgruber, can you please help triage?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm still having difficulty reproducing this in a stable, debuggable way. To summarize findings so far:<span class="line"><!---->I'm still having difficulty reproducing this in a stable, debuggable way. To summarize findings so far:<!----></span><br><br>- There appear to be two different crashes, see the backtraces in <span class="line"><!---->- There appear to be two different crashes, see the backtraces in <!----></span>#c15<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c15"><!---->#c15<!----></a> (crash in irregexp) and in <span class="line"><!----> (crash in irregexp) and in <!----></span>#c14<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c14"><!---->#c14<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>#c16<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c16"><!---->#c16<!----></a> (something else). I've only investigated the former in this bug report.<span class="line"><!----> (something else). I've only investigated the former in this bug report.<!----></span><br>- Crashes are reproduced by clicking HavTest and refreshing. Sometimes the crash seems to reproduce easily, at other times it can take many attempts. Due to memory pressure? Due to cache states? It seems to help to change window focus before refreshing the page.<span class="line"><!---->- Crashes are reproduced by clicking HavTest and refreshing. Sometimes the crash seems to reproduce easily, at other times it can take many attempts. Due to memory pressure? Due to cache states? It seems to help to change window focus before refreshing the page.<!----></span><br>- I attempted to bisect but the crash is too flaky.<span class="line"><!---->- I attempted to bisect but the crash is too flaky.<!----></span><br>- The symptoms quite clearly point at a problem with the regexp bytecode array or regexp interpreter dispatch, specifically dispatch seems to jump to an invalid address (we use the computed goto extension for interpreter dispatch).<span class="line"><!---->- The symptoms quite clearly point at a problem with the regexp bytecode array or regexp interpreter dispatch, specifically dispatch seems to jump to an invalid address (we use the computed goto extension for interpreter dispatch).<!----></span><br>- This can happen either because the read bytecode is invalid (the bytecode array may be corrupted, may have moved, we may read OOB, or may not be a bytecode array at all); or because ASAN somehow interferes with the computed goto extension. The latter is not an academic possibility, we've seen crashes related due to addtl requirements on registers from ASAN in the past.<span class="line"><!---->- This can happen either because the read bytecode is invalid (the bytecode array may be corrupted, may have moved, we may read OOB, or may not be a bytecode array at all); or because ASAN somehow interferes with the computed goto extension. The latter is not an academic possibility, we've seen crashes related due to addtl requirements on registers from ASAN in the past.<!----></span><br>- Unfortunately I haven't managed to debug this properly yet. On my linux laptop, I get neither an ASAN report, nor does gdb break on the segv. On my Windows VM, after jumping through many hoops, I do get symbolized ASAN reports - but the crash is super-flaky and I know nothing about debugging chromium with windbg. Plus the VM is severely resource-constrained and I can't compile custom builds there.<span class="line"><!---->- Unfortunately I haven't managed to debug this properly yet. On my linux laptop, I get neither an ASAN report, nor does gdb break on the segv. On my Windows VM, after jumping through many hoops, I do get symbolized ASAN reports - but the crash is super-flaky and I know nothing about debugging chromium with windbg. Plus the VM is severely resource-constrained and I can't compile custom builds there.<!----></span><br>- Next steps: attempt to repro on a non-ASAN build.<span class="line"><!---->- Next steps: attempt to repro on a non-ASAN build.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tracing isolate creation and flag values suggests something is altering flag values after the Isolate has started:<span class="line"><!---->Tracing isolate creation and flag values suggests something is altering flag values after the Isolate has started:<!----></span><br><br>Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e2b10 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e2b10 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e24d0 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x55614d0e24d0 --jitless 0 --regexp-interpret-all 0<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x7fe744008d50 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x7fe744008d50 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<!----></span><br>Isolate::Init 0x7fe70800d570 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<span class="line"><!---->Isolate::Init 0x7fe70800d570 --jitless 1 --regexp-interpret-all 1<!----></span><br>[...]<span class="line"><!---->[...]<!----></span><br>isolate 0x55614d0e2b10  // Immediately prior to the DCHECK failure.<span class="line"><!---->isolate 0x55614d0e2b10  // Immediately prior to the DCHECK failure.<!----></span><br><br>Note isolate 0x55614d0e2b10 starts with --regexp-interpret-all unset but has the flag set prior to the crash.<span class="line"><!---->Note isolate 0x55614d0e2b10 starts with --regexp-interpret-all unset but has the flag set prior to the crash.<!----></span><br><br>It looks like chrome is misusing V8 by starting multiple isolates with different jitless configs in the same process. I vaguely recall hearing related chatter in recent months, gotta do some research.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like chrome is misusing V8 by starting multiple isolates with different jitless configs in the same process. I vaguely recall hearing related chatter in recent months, gotta do some research.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1262676#c38">Comment 38<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 3, 2021, 3:32 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1262676#c38">Comment 38<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Nov 3, 2021, 3:32 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        jgruber@:<span class="line"><!---->jgruber@:<!----></span><br>- is it possible that you start a V8 isolate with --jitless in a renderer process?<span class="line"><!---->- is it possible that you start a V8 isolate with --jitless in a renderer process?<!----></span><br>Yes. The worklet runs in a renderer process (behind a runtime enabled flag). See<span class="line"><!---->Yes. The worklet runs in a renderer process (behind a runtime enabled flag).         #38: Thanks, that confirms my suspicions. Since v8 flags are process-wide, it's not valid to spawn multiple isolates with different flags in the same process. For --jitless and friends (e.g. --regexp-interpret-all) it's especially problematic. I suspect the second bug report with different symptoms (<span class="line"><!---->#38: Thanks, that confirms my suspicions. Since v8 flags are process-wide, it's not valid to spawn multiple isolates with different flags in the same process. For --jitless and friends (e.g. --regexp-interpret-all) it's especially problematic. I suspect the second bug report with different symptoms (<!----></span>crbug.com/1264813<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264813" title="AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x7ed000084040"><!---->crbug.com/1264813<!----></a>) may have the same root cause.<span class="line"><!---->) may have the same root cause.<!----></span><br><br>1) Since SharedStorageAPI is *not* on by default, there is currently no direct user-visible impact.<span class="line"><!---->1) Since SharedStorageAPI is *not* on by default, there is currently no direct user-visible impact.<!----></span><br><br>2) SharedStorageAPI is currently spawns V8 isolates in a way that interferes with other V8 isolates in the same renderer process and will lead to all kinds of hard-to-debug followup errors. The solution is to not spawn SharedStorageAPI isolates with custom flags (-> remove --jitless).<span class="line"><!---->2) SharedStorageAPI is currently spawns V8 isolates in a way that interferes with other V8 isolates in the same renderer process and will lead to all kinds of hard-to-debug followup errors. The solution is to not spawn SharedStorageAPI isolates with custom flags (-&gt; remove --jitless).<!----></span><br><br>3) For the V8 side, two potential work items are in <span class="line"><!---->3) For the V8 side, two potential work items are in <!----></span>#c34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->#c34<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>yaoxia@ I'm reassigning to you for point 2) above.<span class="line"><!---->yaoxia@ I'm reassigning to you for point 2) above.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

          <tbody>

        </table>

    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1262676: SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: access-violation regexp-interpreter.cc:461 in v8::internal::`anonymous namespace'::RawMatch<unsigned char>
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1262676: SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: access-violation regexp-interpreter.cc:461 in v8::internal::`anonymous namespace'::RawMatch&lt;unsigned char&gt;
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      m.coo...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->m.coo...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      Sat, Oct 23, 2021, 1:19 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Oct 23, 2021, 1:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1262676: SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: access-violation regexp-interpreter.cc:461 in v8::internal::`anonymous namespace'::RawMatch&lt;unsigned char&gt;
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Oct 23, 2021, 1:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1262676: SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: access-violation regexp-interpreter.cc:461 in v8::internal::`anonymous namespace'::RawMatch&lt;unsigned char&gt;
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
